name: ethylene glycols production, thermal hydrolysis of ethylene oxide | ethylene glycol | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9625/documentation

This dataset represents the production of monoethylene glycol (MEG), diethylene glycol (DEG) and triethylene glycol (TEG) through the oxidation of ethylene oxide. ;MEG is mainly used for the manufacture of polyester fibres and polyethylene terephthalate (PET); smaller quantities are used as anti-freezing agent in cooling systems. DEG is used in the fibre industry and as tobacco humectant and TEG is used in the manufacture of cellophane for food packaging. DEG and TEG are both used for gas drying.;Infrastructure is included with a default value. ;This dataset was extrapolated from the European dataset (IFEU/PlasticsEurope, 2021). ;References:;IFEU/PlasticsEurope (2021): Eco-profile of Steam Cracker Products: Ethylene, Propylene, Butadiene, Pyrolysis Gasoline, Ethylene Oxide (EO), Ethylene Glycols (MEG, DEG, TEG);Falcke H.; Holbrook S.; Clenahan I.; Lopez Carretero A.; Sanalan T.; Brinkmann T.; Roth J.; Zerger B.; Roudier S.; Delgado Sancho L. (2017): Best Available Techniques (BAT) Reference Document for the Production of Large Volume Organic Chemicals, JRC Science for Policy Report.;Rebsdat S., Mayer D. (2011): Ethylene Glycol, Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Wiley VCH.

From the reception of ethylene oxide at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the production of diethylene glycol, triethylene glycol and ethylene glycol, 100% at the factory gate. The dataset includes the input materials, energy uses, infrastructure and emissions.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data collection 2019/2020. The technology is not expected to change within 5 years.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset was extrapolated from the European dataset (IFEU/PlasticsEurope, 2021). Therefore the European feedstock mix was applied. Representative for minium 80% of European (EU + GB, NO, CH) production.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This dataset was extrapolated from the European dataset (IFEU/PlasticsEurope, 2021).;Thermal hydrolysis of ethylene oxide accounts for all of the ethylene glycols manufactured in the EU. ;This route involves the following sequence of process steps: ; reaction of ethylene oxide with a significant stoichiometric excess of water at a temperature of 120–250 °C and a pressure above 10–40 bar;; separation by distillation (and subsequent recycling) of the water from the ethylene glycols mixture;; separation by distillation of the mono-, di-, tri- and polyethylene glycols, employing progressively higher levels of vacuum.;;;;C2H4O + H2O --> C2H6O2 (1);C2H6O2 + C2H4O --> C4H10O3 (2);;;C4H10O3 + C2H4O --> C6H14O4 (3);;;;(1) production of MEG from EO and water;;;(2) production of DEG from EO and MEG;;;(3) production of TEG from EO and DEG;;;;Since about 40 % of the EO production in Europe and about 70 % of the worldwide EO production is converted into ethylene glycols, EO and ethylene glycols are mostly produced together at integrated plants.;It is assumed that waste heat is dissipated.;References:;IFEU/PlasticsEurope (2021): Eco-profile of Steam Cracker Products: Ethylene, Propylene, Butadiene, Pyrolysis Gasoline, Ethylene Oxide (EO), Ethylene Glycols (MEG, DEG, TEG);Falcke H.; Holbrook S.; Clenahan I.; Lopez Carretero A.; Sanalan T.; Brinkmann T.; Roth J.; Zerger B.; Roudier S.; Delgado Sancho L. (2017): Best Available Techniques (BAT) Reference Document for the Production of Large Volume Organic Chemicals, JRC Science for Policy Report.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Extrapolation from European dataset. Uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Extrapolation from European dataset. Industry survey complemented with literature data and data from the Reference Document on Best Available Techniques in the Large Volume Organic Chemical Industry (2017)

flow.name: ethylene glycol
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

exchanges.description:
European average value, based on industrial survey, representative for min. 80 % of European (EU + GB, NO, CH) production.
44 g/mol is a molecular weight of ethylene oxide (C2H4O).
62 g/mol is a molecular weight of ethylen glycol (C2H6O2).
106 g/mol is a molecular weight of diethylene glycol (C4H10O3).
150 g/mol is a molecular weight of triethylene glycol (C6H14O4).

Reference:
IFEU/PlasticsEurope (2021): Eco-profile of Steam Cracker Products: Ethylene, Propylene, Butadiene, Pyrolysis Gasoline, Ethylene Oxide (EO), Ethylene Glycols (MEG, DEG, TEG)

exchanges.description:
Calculated based on literature data published by the industry. For this activity, no information was readily available concerning infrastructure and land-use. Therefore, the infrastructure is estimated based on data from two chemical factories, the BASF site of Ludwigshafen and the chemical factory in Gendorf (which are both located in Germany), which produce a wide range of chemical substances. Based on this data, the following assumptions are made: the built area amounts to about 4.2 ha, the plant has an average output of 50'000 t/a and a lifespan of fifty years. The estimated infrastructure amount is therefore 4.00 E-10 units per kg of produced chemical.
44 g/mol is a molecular weight of ethylene oxide (C2H4O).
62 g/mol is a molecular weight of ethylen glycol (C2H6O2).
106 g/mol is a molecular weight of diethylene glycol (C4H10O3).
150 g/mol is a molecular weight of triethylene glycol (C6H14O4).

References:
Althaus H.-J., Chudacoff M., Hischier R., Jungbluth N., Osses M. and Primas A. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Chemicals. ecoinvent report No. 8, v2.0. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.
Gendorf (2000) Umwelterklärung 2000, Werk Gendorf. Werk Gendorf, Burgkirchen.
EcoSpold01Location=RER
